canonical_explanation.text: Everything around us is made of matter. Matter exists in three states: solids, liquids, and gases. Solids have fixed shape and size. Liquids take the shape of their container and can flow. Gases fill up the entire space and can be compressed. Matter can change from one state to another through heating or cooling.
rules: Solids have fixed shape and size (example: stone, ice)
Liquids take the shape of their container and can flow (example: water, milk)
Gases have no fixed shape or size and fill entire space (example: air)
Melting: solid to liquid (ice to water)
Freezing: liquid to solid (water to ice)
Evaporation: liquid to gas (water to steam)

questions.question_text: How many states of matter are there?
questions.explanation_correct: The correct answer is C) Three. This is because matter can exist in three different states: solid, liquid, and gas.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is C) Three. Matter can exist in three different states: solid, liquid, and gas. Option A) One and Option B) Two are incorrect because matter cannot exist in only one or two states. Option D) Four is also incorrect because there are only three states of matter, not four.

questions.question_text: Which of these is a solid?
questions.explanation_correct: Stone is a solid because it has a fixed shape and size. Solids do not change their shape or size easily.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Water is a liquid, not a solid. Liquids can flow and take the shape of their container. Air is a gas, which means it fills up the entire space it is in and can be compressed. Milk is also a liquid, not a solid.

questions.question_text: Which of these is a liquid?
questions.explanation_correct: Water is a liquid. Liquids can flow and take the shape of their container, unlike solids like ice or rocks which have a fixed shape. This makes water a liquid, not a solid or a gas like steam.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Ice and rock are solids, which means they have a fixed shape and size. Steam is a gas, which means it fills up the entire space it is in. Water, on the other hand, is a liquid, which means it can flow and take the shape of its container. This is why water is the correct answer.

questions.question_text: Which of these is a gas?
questions.explanation_correct: Air is a gas because it fills up the entire space and can be easily compressed. Gases do not have a fixed shape or size like solids, and they flow and spread out to fill their container.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Milk, ice, and juice are not gases. Gases are substances that fill up the entire space they are in and can be easily compressed, unlike liquids and solids. Air is a common gas that we breathe every day.

questions.question_text: Solids have:
questions.explanation_correct: Solids have a fixed shape and size. This means they always keep the same shape and size, no matter what container they are in. Solids do not flow or spread out like liquids or gases.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Solids do not have no fixed shape or size. Solids have a definite shape and size that they always keep. They do not take the shape of their container like liquids do, and they cannot be easily compressed like gases can.

questions.question_text: If you pour water into a glass, it will:

options.text: Take the shape of the glass

questions.explanation_correct: When you pour water into a glass, it will take the shape of the glass because liquids can flow and change shape to fit their container. Liquids do not have a fixed shape like solids, so they will mold to the shape of the glass.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The water will not keep its original shape because liquids are not rigid like solids. It also will not become solid or disappear, as those are changes in the state of matter, which does not happen just by pouring water into a glass. Liquids take the shape of their container, so the correct answer is that the water will take the shape of the glass.

questions.question_text: Liquids can:
questions.explanation_correct: Liquids can flow because they do not have a fixed shape. They take the shape of the container they are in. This allows them to move and flow easily.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Liquids cannot have a fixed shape. They are not solids, which have a fixed shape. Liquids take the shape of the container they are in, which allows them to flow and move around easily. The correct answer is that liquids can flow.

questions.question_text: Gases fill:
questions.explanation_correct: Gases fill the entire container because they don't have a fixed shape. Gases spread out and take the shape of the container they are in.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Gases do not only fill half the container, or just the bottom or top. Gases spread out and fill the entire space inside the container. This is because gases don't have a fixed shape like solids, and can move around and expand to take up all the space available.

questions.question_text: Which state of matter can be compressed (squeezed)?
questions.explanation_correct: Gases can be compressed (squeezed) because the particles in a gas have a lot of space between them. When you compress a gas, the particles are pushed closer together, taking up less space.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Solids and liquids cannot be easily compressed. The particles in solids and liquids are already very close together, so it's hard to squeeze them even more. Gases, on the other hand, have a lot of empty space between the particles, so they can be compressed (squeezed) to take up less space.

questions.question_text: When ice melts, it becomes:
questions.explanation_correct: When ice melts, it becomes water. This is because ice is the solid form of water, and when it is heated, the ice changes into its liquid form, which is water.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Ice is the solid form of water. When ice is heated, it melts and becomes a liquid, which is water. It does not become steam (the gas form of water), air (which is a mixture of gases), or stone (a solid mineral).

questions.question_text: When water freezes, it becomes:
questions.explanation_correct: When water freezes, it becomes ice. This is because when water is cooled down, it changes from a liquid state to a solid state, which is ice.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The other options are not correct because steam is the gas state of water, milk is a liquid made from cows, and juice is a liquid made from fruits. Water only becomes ice when it freezes, which is the solid state of water.

questions.question_text: When water boils, it changes into:
questions.explanation_correct: When water boils, it changes into steam. Steam is a gas, which is one of the three states of matter. Heating water makes it change from a liquid to a gas.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Water does not change into ice or a solid when it boils. It also does not change into juice, which is a liquid made from fruits. When water is heated, it changes from a liquid to a gas, which is called steam.

questions.question_text: Changing from solid to liquid is called:
questions.explanation_correct: The correct answer is 'Melting' because when a solid changes to a liquid, it is called melting. For example, when ice cubes are heated, they melt and become liquid water.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The other options are not correct. 'Freezing' is when a liquid changes to a solid, 'Evaporation' is when a liquid changes to a gas, and 'Condensation' is when a gas changes to a liquid. Melting is the correct term for when a solid changes to a liquid.

questions.question_text: Changing from liquid to solid is called:
questions.explanation_correct: Changing from liquid to solid is called freezing. When a liquid is cooled, its molecules slow down and pack together, forming a solid with a fixed shape and size.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Changing from liquid to solid is not called melting, evaporation, or boiling. Melting is when a solid changes to a liquid, and evaporation is when a liquid changes to a gas. Boiling is when a liquid changes to a gas. Changing from liquid to solid is called freezing, where the liquid cools down and becomes a solid.

questions.question_text: Changing from liquid to gas is called:
questions.explanation_correct: Changing from a liquid to a gas is called evaporation. When a liquid gets hot, the particles in the liquid move faster and escape into the air, turning into a gas. This is what we call evaporation.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Freezing is when a liquid turns into a solid by getting very cold. Melting is when a solid turns into a liquid by getting hot. Condensation is when a gas turns into a liquid by getting cold. But changing from a liquid to a gas is called evaporation, where the liquid particles escape into the air and become a gas.

questions.question_text: When steam touches a cold mirror, it becomes water drops. This is called:
questions.explanation_correct: When steam (which is a gas) touches a cold mirror, it cools down and changes into water drops. This process of a gas changing into a liquid is called condensation.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Condensation is not the same as evaporation or melting. Evaporation is when a liquid changes into a gas, like water turning into steam. Melting is when a solid changes into a liquid, like ice turning into water. Freezing is when a liquid changes into a solid, like water turning into ice. In this case, the steam is changing into water drops, which is the process of condensation.

questions.question_text: Wet clothes dry because water:
questions.explanation_correct: Wet clothes dry because water evaporates. Evaporation is when liquid water turns into a gas called water vapor. As the water vapor spreads out in the air, the wet clothes become dry.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Water does not freeze, condense, or melt when wet clothes are drying. The water in the wet clothes evaporates, turning from a liquid into a gas. This makes the clothes become dry.

questions.question_text: Tables and chairs are made of:
questions.explanation_correct: Tables and chairs are made of wood. Wood is a solid material that has a fixed shape and size. It is used to make many everyday objects like tables, chairs, and desks.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Tables and chairs are not made of water, air, or steam. Water, air, and steam are all materials that are in the liquid or gas state. Solids like wood are used to make furniture because they have a fixed shape and size that can support the weight of people sitting on them.

questions.question_text: Windows are made of:
questions.explanation_correct: Windows are made of glass because glass is a solid material that can be shaped into thin, transparent sheets. Glass has a fixed shape and size, which is perfect for making windows that allow us to see through them.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Windows are not made of wood, plastic, or cloth. Wood, plastic, and cloth are all materials that would not be suitable for making windows because they are not transparent. Glass is the best material for making windows because it is solid, transparent, and can be shaped into thin sheets.

questions.question_text: Cooking pots are usually made of:
questions.explanation_correct: Cooking pots are usually made of metal because metals are good at conducting heat and can withstand high temperatures, which is important for cooking food.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Plastic, paper, and cloth are not good materials for making cooking pots. Plastic and paper can melt or catch fire at high temperatures, and cloth is not durable enough to be used for cooking. Metal, on the other hand, is a strong and heat-resistant material that can be used to make sturdy cooking pots.

questions.question_text: Plastic is used to make bottles because it is:

options.text: Light and does not break easily

questions.explanation_correct: Plastic is light and does not break easily, which makes it a good material to use for bottles. Bottles made of plastic are less likely to break or crack when dropped compared to glass bottles.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Plastic is not heavy, expensive, or always hot. It is a lightweight and durable material that can withstand impacts and pressure, which is why it is a common choice for making bottles. Bottles made of plastic are easier to carry and less likely to break compared to glass bottles.

questions.question_text: Which of these is NOT a solid?
questions.explanation_correct: Juice is a liquid, not a solid. Liquids can flow and take the shape of their container, unlike solids which have a fixed shape and size.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A book, a chair, and a pencil are all solids because they have a fixed shape and size. Solids are one of the three states of matter, the other two being liquids and gases. Liquids, like juice, can flow and take the shape of their container.

questions.question_text: Why can we not see most gases?
questions.explanation_correct: Gases are colorless and transparent, which means we can't see them. This is why we can't see most gases around us.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Gases are not very small, nor do they hide from us or only come at night. Gases are made of tiny particles that are spread out and don't have a fixed shape or size. This is why we can't see them - they are colorless and transparent, unlike solids and liquids.

questions.question_text: Butter melts when we heat it because:

options.text: Heat changes it from solid to liquid

questions.explanation_correct: Butter melts when heated because the heat changes it from a solid state to a liquid state. Heat gives the molecules in butter enough energy to start moving more freely, which makes it become a liquid.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Butter does not become smaller or disappear when heated. It also does not turn into a gas. When butter is heated, the heat energy causes the solid butter to change into a liquid form, which is why it melts. This is because the heat makes the molecules in the butter move around more, causing it to change from a solid to a liquid state.

questions.question_text: Rubber is used to make:
questions.explanation_correct: Rubber is used to make tyres because rubber is a soft, flexible material that can stretch and bounce back, which is perfect for making tyres on vehicles like cars and bicycles.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Rubber is not used to make windows, tables, or books. Windows are usually made of glass, tables are made of wood or metal, and books have pages made of paper. Rubber is a special material that is best suited for making tyres on vehicles because it is soft, stretchy, and can bounce back into shape.

questions.question_text: Steam is an example of:
questions.explanation_correct: Steam is an example of a gas because it is the gaseous, invisible form of water when it is heated. Gases can fill up the entire space they are in and can be easily compressed, which is what happens when water is turned into steam.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Steam is not a solid or a liquid. It is the gaseous, invisible form of water when it is heated. Solids have a fixed shape and size, while liquids take the shape of their container and can flow. Steam, on the other hand, is a gas that fills up the entire space it is in and can be easily compressed.

questions.question_text: A bicycle pump works because:
questions.explanation_correct: A bicycle pump works because air can be compressed. Air is a gas, and gases can be squeezed and forced into a smaller space. When you push down on the pump, the air inside gets compressed, and this compressed air comes out through the nozzle to inflate the bicycle tire.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The bicycle pump does not work because air is solid or liquid. Air is a gas, and gases can be compressed, which means they can be squeezed into a smaller space. This is why the bicycle pump works - when you push down on the pump, the air inside gets compressed, and this compressed air comes out through the nozzle to inflate the tire.

questions.question_text: Ice cream left outside on a hot day will:
questions.explanation_correct: Ice cream is a solid. When left outside on a hot day, the heat causes the ice cream to change from a solid to a liquid state, which is called melting.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Ice cream left outside on a hot day will not stay the same, freeze more, or become harder. This is because the heat from the hot day will cause the ice cream, which is a solid, to melt and turn into a liquid.

questions.question_text: Which material can break easily?
questions.explanation_correct: Glass can break easily because it is a solid material that is hard and brittle. When you apply force on glass, it cracks and shatters into pieces very quickly.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Rubber, plastic, and wood are all solid materials, but they are more flexible and less brittle than glass. Even if you apply force on them, they don't break as easily as glass. Glass is the most fragile and breakable among these options.

questions.question_text: Oil floats on water because:
questions.explanation_correct: Oil floats on water because oil is lighter than water. Oil has a lower density than water, so it rises to the top and floats on the surface of water.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Oil does not float on water because it is a gas. Gases like air fill up the entire space and can be compressed, but oil is a liquid. Liquids take the shape of their container and can flow. Since oil is a liquid that is lighter than water, it floats on the surface of water.

questions.question_text: Ice is a solid.
questions.explanation_correct: Ice is a solid because it has a fixed shape and size. Solids are one of the three states of matter, and ice is an example of a solid.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Ice is not a liquid or a gas. It is a solid, which means it has a fixed shape and size. Solids are one of the three states of matter, and ice is an example of a solid.

questions.question_text: Water is a gas.
questions.explanation_correct: Water is not a gas. Water is a liquid at room temperature. It only becomes a gas (water vapor) when it is heated and changes into steam.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Water is not a gas. It is a liquid. Liquids take the shape of their container, while gases fill up the entire space they are in. Water can be poured and it flows, which means it is a liquid, not a gas.

questions.question_text: Solids have a fixed shape.
questions.explanation_correct: Solids have a fixed shape because the particles in a solid are tightly packed together and cannot move around freely. This means solids always keep the same shape, unlike liquids and gases.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Liquids and gases do not have a fixed shape. Liquids take the shape of the container they are in, and gases fill up the entire space they are in. But solids are different - the particles in a solid are fixed in place, so solids have a fixed shape that does not change.

questions.question_text: Liquids can be poured.
questions.explanation_correct: Liquids can be poured because they flow and take the shape of their container. This is one of the main properties of liquids.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Liquids cannot be poured because they have a fixed shape. This is not correct. Liquids can flow and take the shape of their container, so they can be easily poured from one container to another.

questions.question_text: Gases have a fixed shape.
questions.explanation_correct: Gases do not have a fixed shape. They take the shape of the container they are in and fill up the entire space.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Gases do not have a fixed shape like solids. They can change their shape and size easily. Gases can be compressed and spread out to fill up the entire space they are in, unlike solids which have a fixed shape.

questions.question_text: Ice melts when heated.
questions.explanation_correct: Yes, ice melts when heated. When ice is heated, the energy from the heat makes the molecules in the ice move faster and spread out. This changes the ice from a solid to a liquid, which is called melting.
questions.explanation_incorrect: No, ice does not stay solid when heated. When ice is heated, the heat energy makes the molecules in the ice move faster and spread out. This causes the ice to change from a solid to a liquid, which is called melting. So ice melts when heated.

questions.question_text: Water freezes when heated.
questions.explanation_correct: Water freezes when it is cooled down, not when it is heated. Heating makes water turn into steam, which is a gas. Cooling makes water turn into ice, which is a solid.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Water does not freeze when it is heated. When water is heated, it turns into steam, which is a gas. To make water freeze and turn into solid ice, you need to cool it down, not heat it up.

questions.question_text: Evaporation changes liquid into gas.
questions.explanation_correct: Evaporation is the process that changes liquid into gas. When a liquid is heated, the particles in the liquid gain energy and escape into the air as gas. This is how evaporation turns a liquid into a gas.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Evaporation does not change a liquid into a solid. Solids have a fixed shape and size, while liquids take the shape of their container and can flow. Heating a liquid causes the particles to gain energy and turn into a gas, not a solid. So the statement 'Evaporation changes liquid into gas' is true.

questions.question_text: Glass is used to make windows.
questions.explanation_correct: Glass is used to make windows because glass is a solid material that is transparent. This means you can see through it, making it a good choice for windows.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Glass is not a liquid or a gas, it is a solid material. Solids have a fixed shape and size, which makes them good for making windows that need to hold their shape and size. Liquids and gases would not work well for making windows.

questions.question_text: Steam is the liquid form of water.
questions.explanation_correct: Steam is not the liquid form of water. Steam is the gas form of water. When water is heated, it turns into steam, which is invisible water vapor in the air.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Steam is the gas form of water, not the liquid form. When water is heated, it turns into steam, which is a gas. Liquids have a fixed shape and take the shape of their container, while gases fill up the entire space around them.

questions.question_text: The three states of matter are solid, liquid, and _____.
questions.explanation_correct: The three states of matter are solid, liquid, and gas. Gas is the third state of matter. Gases take up the full space they are in and can be compressed, unlike solids and liquids.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The three states of matter are solid, liquid, and gas. The correct answer is 'gas'. Gases are the third state of matter, and they fill up the entire space they are in. They are different from solids, which have a fixed shape and size, and liquids, which take the shape of their container.

questions.question_text: Ice is a _____ state of water.
questions.explanation_correct: Ice is a solid state of water. Solids have a fixed shape and size, unlike liquids and gases. When water is cooled, it turns into solid ice, which is hard and has a fixed shape.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is solid. Solids have a fixed shape and size, unlike liquids and gases. Water can exist in three states: solid (ice), liquid (water), and gas (steam). When water is cooled, it turns into solid ice, which is a solid state of water.

questions.question_text: Liquids take the _____ of their container.
questions.explanation_correct: Liquids take the shape of their container because they can flow and change shape easily. They don't have a fixed shape like solids, so they will take the shape of whatever they are poured into.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is 'shape'. Liquids do not have a fixed size or shape like solids. Instead, they will take the shape of the container they are in. For example, if you pour water into a glass, it will take the shape of the glass. The wrong answer would be something like 'size', because liquids can change their size to fit the container.

questions.question_text: _____ can be compressed but solids and liquids cannot.
questions.explanation_correct: Gases can be compressed because they are made up of particles that are loosely packed and have a lot of space between them. This allows the particles to be pushed closer together when pressure is applied. Solids and liquids, on the other hand, have their particles more tightly packed, so they cannot be easily compressed.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is 'Gases'. Solids and liquids cannot be compressed because their particles are tightly packed together. Gases, however, can be compressed because their particles are loosely packed and have a lot of space between them. When pressure is applied, the gas particles can be pushed closer together.

questions.question_text: When ice is heated, it _____ and becomes water.
questions.explanation_correct: When ice is heated, it melts and becomes water. This is because heat energy makes the molecules in ice move faster and overcome the forces holding them together, causing the ice to change its state from a solid to a liquid.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is 'melts'. When ice is heated, the heat energy makes the molecules in the ice move faster, and they overcome the forces holding them together. This causes the ice to change its state from a solid to a liquid, which we call 'melting'.

questions.question_text: When water is cooled, it _____ and becomes ice.
questions.explanation_correct: When water is cooled, it freezes and becomes ice. This is because when water gets cold, its molecules slow down and start to stick together, forming a solid structure that we call ice.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is 'freezes'. When water is cooled, its molecules slow down and start to stick together, forming a solid structure that we call ice. The water does not 'boil' or 'melt' when it is cooled, it 'freezes' and becomes ice.

questions.question_text: When water is boiled, it changes into _____.
questions.explanation_correct: When water is boiled, it turns into steam. Steam is a gas that is created when water is heated to a high temperature. This is because the heat makes the water molecules move faster and turn into a gas.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is steam. Steam is a gas that is created when water is boiled. It is not a liquid or a solid. The water changes from a liquid to a gas when it is heated to a high temperature. The accepted answer format is 'steam'.

questions.question_text: When steam cools down on a cold surface, it becomes water drops. This is called _____.
questions.explanation_correct: When steam (hot water vapor) cools down, it changes back into liquid water drops. This process of steam turning into water is called condensation.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The process where steam turns into water drops is called condensation. The correct answer is 'condensation'. Some students may think this process is called 'evaporation', but that is when liquid water turns into steam, not the other way around.

questions.question_text: Tables and chairs are made of _____.
questions.explanation_correct: Tables and chairs are commonly made of wood, which comes from trees. Wood is strong and can be shaped into furniture.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Think about what most tables and chairs are made from â€” wood is the most common material used to build furniture.

questions.question_text: Cooking pots are usually made of _____.
questions.explanation_correct: Cooking pots are usually made of metal because metal is a solid material that can withstand high temperatures. Metals are good at conducting heat, which makes them perfect for cooking pots and pans.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Cooking pots are usually not made of gas or liquid materials. Gases and liquids cannot hold their shape, so they would not be suitable for making cooking pots. The correct answer is that cooking pots are usually made of metal, which is a solid material that can keep its shape and withstand high temperatures during cooking.

questions.question_text: Tyres are made of _____.
questions.explanation_correct: Tyres are made of rubber because rubber is a material that is flexible, durable, and can withstand the pressure and weight of a car. Rubber is a solid material that is perfect for making tyres that need to be strong and able to grip the road.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Tyres are not made of metal or glass. They are made of a material called rubber. Rubber is a solid material that is flexible and can stretch, which is why it is the perfect material for making tyres. The correct answer is 'rubber'.

questions.question_text: Wet clothes dry because water _____ into the air.
questions.explanation_correct: Wet clothes dry because the water in them evaporates, or turns into water vapor, and goes into the air around us. This happens when the water is heated up by the sun or air, causing it to change from a liquid to a gas.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The water in the wet clothes does not disappear. Instead, it evaporates, or turns into water vapor, and goes into the air around us. The correct answer is 'evaporates'.

questions.question_text: Arrange water's states from coldest to hottest form.
questions.explanation_correct: The correct order of water's states from coldest to hottest is: Ice (solid), Water (liquid), Steam (gas). This is because as you add heat, water changes from a solid (ice) to a liquid (water) to a gas (steam).
questions.explanation_incorrect: The incorrect order would be: Steam (gas), Water (liquid), Ice (solid). This is wrong because as you cool down water, it first becomes a liquid (water), then a solid (ice). It does not go directly from a gas (steam) to a solid (ice).

questions.question_text: Arrange the steps of making ice cubes in order.
questions.explanation_correct: The correct order is: Pour water into ice tray, Put ice tray in freezer, Water freezes into ice, Take out ice cubes. This is the right order because you need to first pour the water into the ice tray, then put the tray in the freezer so the water can freeze and turn into ice, and finally take out the ice cubes once they are ready.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The incorrect order would be: Water freezes into ice, Pour water into ice tray, Put ice tray in freezer, Take out ice cubes. This is wrong because you can't freeze the water until you have poured it into the ice tray and put the tray in the freezer. The correct order is to pour the water, then put the tray in the freezer, then the water will freeze into ice, and finally you can take out the ice cubes.

questions.question_text: Arrange the water cycle steps in order.
ordering_items: Water vapor condenses to form clouds
correct_answer: Water vapor condenses to form clouds
questions.explanation_correct: The correct order is: Sun heats water, Water evaporates, Water vapor condenses to form clouds, Rain falls. This is because the sun's heat causes water to evaporate from oceans, lakes, and rivers. The water vapor then rises up and condenses into clouds. When the clouds get too full, the water falls back down as rain.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The incorrect order would be: Water vapor condenses to form clouds, Sun heats water, Rain falls, Water evaporates. This is not correct because the first step is the sun heating the water, which causes the water to evaporate and turn into water vapor. The water vapor then condenses to form clouds, and the clouds eventually release the water as rain.

questions.question_text: Arrange states of matter by how easily they can be compressed (easiest to hardest).
questions.explanation_correct: Gases can be compressed the most easily because they have no fixed shape or size. Liquids and solids are harder to compress because they have a more defined shape and size.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The order from easiest to hardest to compress is gas, liquid, solid. Gases are the easiest to compress because they have no fixed shape or size and can be squeezed into a smaller space. Liquids are harder to compress than gases, but easier than solids. Solids are the hardest to compress because they have a fixed shape and size that is difficult to change.

questions.question_text: Arrange from solid to liquid to gas.
questions.explanation_correct: The answer is correct because ice is a solid, water is a liquid, and water vapor is a gas. This is the order from solid to liquid to gas, which is how the states of matter change when matter is heated or cooled.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The incorrect answer would be to arrange the items as Water vapor, Water, Ice. This is not correct because the order should be from solid to liquid to gas. Ice is a solid, water is a liquid, and water vapor is a gas. The states of matter change as matter is heated or cooled, going from solid to liquid to gas.

questions.question_text: How is a stone different from water?

options.text: A stone can flow but water cannot
A stone has a fixed shape but water takes the shape of its container
Water has a fixed shape but a stone does not

questions.explanation_correct: A stone is a solid, so it has a fixed shape and size. Water is a liquid, so it does not have a fixed shape. Water takes the shape of whatever container you pour it into.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A stone cannot flow because it is a solid with a fixed shape. Water is a liquid, so it can flow and takes the shape of its container. They are not the same because a stone is solid and water is liquid.

questions.question_text: How is air different from milk?

options.text: Air fills the whole container but milk settles at the bottom
Milk fills the whole container but air settles at the bottom

questions.explanation_correct: Air is a gas. Gases spread out and fill the entire container. Milk is a liquid. Liquids settle at the bottom and take the shape of the container, but they do not fill the whole space above them.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Milk is a liquid, so it sits at the bottom part of a container. Air is a gas, so it spreads everywhere and fills the entire space. Liquids and gases behave differently because their tiny particles move in different ways.

questions.question_text: How is melting different from freezing?

options.text: Melting needs cooling, freezing needs heating
Melting changes solid to liquid, freezing changes liquid to solid

questions.explanation_correct: Melting and freezing are opposite changes. In melting, a solid turns into a liquid when it is heated. In freezing, a liquid turns into a solid when it is cooled. For example, ice melts into water, and water freezes into ice.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Melting and freezing are not the same. Melting happens when something gets warmer and changes from solid to liquid, like ice becoming water. Freezing happens when something gets colder and changes from liquid to solid, like water becoming ice.

questions.question_text: How is a glass bottle different from a plastic bottle?

options.text: A glass bottle is lighter and harder to break
A plastic bottle is heavier and breaks easily
A glass bottle breaks easily but a plastic bottle does not

questions.explanation_correct: Glass is a hard but brittle material. If you drop a glass bottle, it can crack or shatter. Plastic is lighter and more flexible, so a plastic bottle does not break easily when dropped.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Glass bottles are heavier than plastic bottles and they break much more easily. Plastic is a flexible material that can bend without breaking. That is why plastic bottles are safer for children to use.

questions.question_text: How is a solid different from a gas?

options.text: A solid has a fixed shape, but a gas has no fixed shape
A gas has a fixed shape, but a solid does not

questions.explanation_correct: A solid like a book or a pencil always keeps the same shape. A gas like air has no fixed shape or size. It spreads out to fill the entire space it is in. This is one of the biggest differences between solids and gases.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Gases do not have a fixed shape. They spread out to fill the whole space around them. Solids always keep their own shape. A pencil stays pencil-shaped no matter where you put it, but air spreads everywhere.

questions.question_text: Something that can flow, can be poured, and takes the shape of its container is a:
questions.explanation_correct: A liquid can flow, can be poured, and takes the shape of its container. Water, milk, and juice are all liquids. They do not have their own fixed shape like solids do.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Solids cannot flow or be poured. They have a fixed shape. Gases can flow, but they fill the entire container, not just the bottom part. Only liquids can be poured and settle at the bottom, taking the shape of the container.

questions.question_text: Something that has no fixed shape, spreads out everywhere, and fills the whole room is a:
questions.explanation_correct: A gas has no fixed shape and it spreads out to fill the entire space. When you open a perfume bottle, the smell reaches the whole room because the perfume gas spreads everywhere. This is a property of gases.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Solids have a fixed shape and cannot spread out. Liquids can flow but they settle at the bottom and do not fill the whole room. Only gases spread out to fill the entire space they are in.

questions.question_text: A material that is hard, strong, gets hot quickly, and is used for cooking pots is:
questions.explanation_correct: Metal is hard, strong, and heats up quickly. These properties make it the best material for cooking pots. Metals like steel and aluminium can handle high heat without melting or catching fire.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Rubber is soft and flexible, not hard. Paper is thin and can catch fire easily. Cloth is soft and cannot hold water or withstand heat. Only metal is hard, strong, and good at conducting heat, which is why we use it for cooking pots.

questions.question_text: Which of these is a gas?
questions.explanation_correct: The smell from food cooking is carried by gases in the air. You cannot see it or hold it, and it spreads across the room on its own. Milk and honey are liquids, and a pencil is a solid.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Milk and honey are liquids because they can flow and be poured. A pencil is a solid because it has a fixed shape. The smell from food cooking spreads through the air as a gas, which is why it reaches your nose even from another room.

questions.question_text: Riya left a glass of water in the freezer overnight. What will she find in the morning?

options.text: The water will still be liquid
The water will turn into ice
The water will turn into steam

questions.explanation_correct: The freezer is very cold. When water gets very cold, it freezes and changes from a liquid into a solid called ice. So Riya will find ice in the glass in the morning.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Water does not stay liquid in a freezer because it is too cold. It does not turn into steam because steam forms when water is heated, not cooled. The glass will not be empty. The water changes into ice because the freezer cools it down.

questions.question_text: Amit's mother is boiling water in the kitchen. He sees something white rising from the pot. What is it?
questions.explanation_correct: When water is heated and boils, it changes from a liquid into a gas called steam. The white cloud Amit sees rising from the pot is steam. This is an example of evaporation, where liquid water turns into water vapour.
questions.explanation_incorrect: It is not smoke, dust, or ice. When water boils, it gets very hot and changes into steam, which is water in its gas form. The white cloud coming from the boiling pot is steam rising into the air.

questions.question_text: Priya dropped her glass of juice on the floor. The glass broke into many pieces but the juice spread all over the floor. Why did the juice spread?

options.text: Because juice is a liquid and liquids can flow
Because the floor pushed the juice away

questions.explanation_correct: Juice is a liquid. Liquids can flow and spread out. When the glass broke, there was nothing to hold the juice, so it flowed out and spread across the floor. This is a property of all liquids.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Juice is not a gas or a solid. It is a liquid. Liquids flow and spread out when they are not inside a container. The floor did not push the juice. The juice spread on its own because that is what liquids do when they are free to move.

questions.question_text: Rohan took a chocolate bar out of the fridge and left it on the table on a hot day. After some time, the chocolate became soft and sticky. What happened to the chocolate?

options.text: It started to melt because of the heat

questions.explanation_correct: Chocolate is a solid that can melt when it gets warm. On a hot day, the heat makes the solid chocolate start to change into a softer, more liquid form. This is melting, which is when a solid changes to a liquid because of heat.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The chocolate did not freeze because freezing happens when things get cold, not hot. It did not evaporate or become a gas because chocolate does not turn into gas at normal temperatures. The heat from the hot day made the chocolate start to melt.

questions.question_text: Meera blew air into a balloon. The balloon became big and round. Why did the balloon change shape?

options.text: Because the air inside is a solid and pushed the balloon out
Because the air is a gas and it filled up the entire space inside the balloon
Because the air turned into water inside the balloon

questions.explanation_correct: Air is a gas. Gases spread out and fill all the space they can. When Meera blew air into the balloon, the gas filled up the space inside and pushed the walls of the balloon outward, making it big and round.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Air is not a solid, and it did not turn into water. The balloon changed shape because air is a gas that fills up the entire space inside the balloon. Gases have no fixed shape and they spread out to fill any container, including a balloon.

questions.question_text: Which of these is NOT true about liquids?

options.text: Liquids take the shape of their container
Liquids have a fixed shape like solids

questions.explanation_correct: Liquids do NOT have a fixed shape like solids. That is the one statement that is wrong. Liquids can flow, can be poured, and take the shape of their container. Only solids have a fixed shape.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Liquids can flow, can be poured, and take the shape of their container. All those are true. The only wrong statement is that liquids have a fixed shape like solids. Liquids change their shape depending on the container.

questions.question_text: Which of these will NOT melt when heated?
questions.explanation_correct: A stone will not melt when you heat it a little. Ice, butter, and chocolate all melt easily with a small amount of heat. But a stone needs extremely high temperatures to melt, much more than we use at home.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Ice melts into water, butter melts into a liquid, and chocolate becomes soft and gooey when heated. These all melt easily. A stone does not melt with normal heat. It stays solid because it needs much, much more heat to melt than we have at home.

questions.question_text: Which of these is NOT true about gases?

options.text: Gases can be squeezed into a smaller space
Gases have a fixed shape and size

questions.explanation_correct: Gases do NOT have a fixed shape and size. That statement is wrong. Gases have no fixed shape, they spread out to fill the whole container, and they can be compressed into a smaller space.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Gases have no fixed shape, they fill the whole container, and they can be squeezed. All of those are true. The only wrong statement is that gases have a fixed shape and size. Only solids have a fixed shape and size.

questions.question_text: Why does ice cream melt on a hot day?

options.text: Because the sun makes it smaller
Because heat changes it from solid to liquid
Because ice cream is always liquid
Because the wind blows it away

questions.explanation_correct: Ice cream is a solid when it is frozen. On a hot day, the heat from the sun warms up the ice cream and changes it from a solid to a liquid. This change is called melting.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Ice cream does not get smaller from the sun, and the wind does not blow it away. Ice cream is frozen solid, not always liquid. It melts on a hot day because the heat changes it from a solid into a liquid.

questions.question_text: Why do wet clothes dry faster on a sunny day than on a cloudy day?

options.text: Because the sun eats the water
Because more heat from the sun makes water evaporate faster
Because clouds make the clothes heavier
Because the sun turns clothes into gas

questions.explanation_correct: On a sunny day, there is more heat from the sun. This extra heat makes the water in the wet clothes evaporate faster. Evaporation is when liquid water changes into water vapour, a gas that goes into the air. More heat means faster evaporation.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The sun does not eat water or turn clothes into gas. Clouds do not make clothes heavier. Wet clothes dry because the water in them evaporates. On a sunny day, there is more heat, so the water evaporates faster and the clothes dry quicker.

questions.question_text: Why are cooking pots made of metal and not paper?

options.text: Because metal is cheaper than paper
Because metal can handle heat but paper would burn
Because metal is softer than paper

questions.explanation_correct: Metal is strong and can handle very high heat without getting damaged. Paper is thin and catches fire easily when it gets hot. That is why we use metal to make cooking pots and not paper.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Paper is actually lighter than metal, not heavier. Metal is harder, not softer. The real reason is that metal can handle the high heat of a stove without burning, but paper would catch fire. That is why cooking pots must be made of metal.
